name: Abacaxi Ricaço
garnish: Cut a straw sized hole in the top of the pineapple shell & replace it as a lid
serving_suggestion: Serve in a Pineapple shell (frozen) glass
ingredients: ['1 whole Pineapple (fresh)', '3 shot Havana Club 3 Year Old rum', '3⁄4 shot Lime juice (freshly squeezed)', '1⁄2 shot White caster sugar']
steps: Cut the top off a small pineapple and carefully scoop out the flesh from the base to leave a shell with 12mm (½ inch) thick walls. Place the shell in a freezer to chill. Remove the hard core from the pineapple flesh and discard; roughly chop the remaining flesh, add other ingredients and BLEND with one 12oz scoop of crushed ice. Pour into the pineapple shell and serve with straws. (The flesh of one pineapple blended with the following ingredients will fill at least two shells).
ingredients_clean: ['whole Pineapple', 'Havana Club Year Old rum', 'Lime juice', 'White caster sugar']
serving_suggestion_clean: Serve in a Pineapple shell (frozen) glass

name: Berry Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
ingredients: ['1⁄2 fresh Lime (fresh) (chopped)', '3 spoon White caster sugar', '3 fresh Raspberries (fresh)', '2 fresh Blackberries', '3 fresh Blueberries (fresh)', '1 fresh Small ripe strawberries (hulled)', '2 shot Novo Fogo Silver cachaça (from freezer)']
steps:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add 3 bar spoons caster sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. Add mixed berries and MUDDLE some more.

4. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

6. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes using an Ice Tapper and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients_clean: ['Lime', 'White caster sugar', 'Raspberries', 'Blackberries', 'Blueberries', 'Small ripe strawberries', 'Novo Fogo Silver cacha a']

name: Blue Blazer
ingredients: ["4 shot Dewar's 12 Year Old Scotch whisky", '4 shot Boiling water', '1 spoon Powdered sugar (ground in mortar and pestle)']
steps:
You will need a pair of large silver-plated tankards (blazer mugs) with handles. Preheat these with boiling water and warm the whisky. POUR the whisky into one tankard and fresh boiling water into the other. Ignite the whisky using a long match and while still blazing pour the whisky into the other tankard. Then mix ingredients by pouring them from one tankard to the other. The foolhardy increase the distance between the tankards as they pour, thus creating a spectacular long blue flame between the two. Extinguish flame by covering flaming tankard with base of the other tankard, pour into glass and sweeten to taste by stirring in powdered sugar.

WARNING - please practice with water first to perfect your method. Stand on a non-flammable floor and have suitable fire-fighting equipment nearby. The following recipe makes two drinks.
ingredients_clean: ["Dewar's Year Old Scotch whisky", 'Boiling water', 'Powdered sugar']

name: Brandy Crusta
garnish: Some merely shove a wide long piece of lemon peel around the inside of the glass rim, leaving the drinker to push the peel down into the glass in order to sip from the drink. Instead I prefer the peel to become a watertight extension to the glass. Find a lemon which fits snugly in the top of a small wine, flute or sour glass. Cut off both ends of the fruit and carefully remove the pulp to leave a barrel-shaped shell of skin. Place in the top of the glass. Wet the edge of the glass and exposed fruit shell with sugar syrup and dip in caster sugar to frost the edge of both peel and glass. Leave for a couple of hours to form a hard crust that helps secure the peel.

name: Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
ingredients: ['1⁄2 fresh Lime (fresh) (chopped)', '3 spoon Powdered sugar (ground in mortar and pestle)', '3⁄4 shot Chilled water (omit if using wet ice)', '2 shot Novo Fogo Silver cachaça (from freezer)']
steps:
1. Cut a ripe lime in half (from pole to pole) and remove the core from each half by cutting a cut a v-shaped grove. You'll need one-half of the lime per drink and this should be chopped into wedges and each wedge chopped in half before dropping the resulting 6 or 8 lime chunks into the base tin of a shaker.

2. Add 3 bar spoons powdered sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. If using cubed ice straight from the freezer, add chilled water (or optionally add fruit of choice) and MUDDLE some more. If using watery ice then omit some or all of the water/juice.

4. When sure the limes's juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, POUR the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the shaker tin used to muddle and swirl to rinse tin before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to mix with other ingredients.

6. If using cubed ice, crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes using an Ice Tapper and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients_clean: ['Lime', 'Powdered sugar', 'Chilled water', 'Novo Fogo Silver cacha a']

name: Absinthe Drip Cocktail (French method)
serving_suggestion: Serve in an Absinthe glass or old-fashioned glass
ingredients: ['1 1⁄2 shot La Fée Parisienne absinthe', '2 shot Chilled water', '1 cube Sugar cube']
steps: POUR absinthe into glass. PLACE cube of sugar on a slotted absinthe spoon resting across the top of the glass. Using an absinthe fountain (or a bottle of chilled mineral water with a small hole in the cap), DRIP iced water over the sugar so it dissolves and drips into the glass. Traditionally the same amount of water is added as absinthe, but full-strength absinthe requires more dilution - Keep dripping until absinthe louches (turns milky white). Add ice, stir and serve.
ingredients_clean: ['La Fée Parisienne absinthe', 'Chilled water', 'Sugar']
serving_suggestion_clean: Serve in an Absinthe glass or old-fashioned glass

name: Absinthe Drip Cocktail (Czech method)
serving_suggestion: Serve in an Absinthe glass or old-fashioned glass
ingredients: ['1 1⁄2 shot La Fée Parisienne absinthe', '2 shot Chilled water', '1 cube White caster sugar']
steps: PLACE sugar cube on a slotted absinthe spoon resting across the top of the glass. POUR the absinthe over the sugar cube into the glass. LIGHT the absinthe soaked cube and leave to burn and caramelise. Using a bottle of chilled mineral water with a small hole in the cap, DRIP water over what's left of the sugar so it dissolves and drips into the glass. Add ice, stir and serve.
ingredients_clean: ['La Fée Parisienne absinthe', 'Chilled water', 'White caster sugar']
serving_suggestion_clean: Serve in an Absinthe glass or old-fashioned glass

name: Daiquiri
garnish: Lime zest twist (discarded) & lime wedge on rim

steps:
Cut zest from your lime for garnish prior to squeezing for juice. SHAKE all ingredients with ice and fine strain into chilled glass.

For an even better Daiquiri use 2 x 5ml measuring spoons of powdered sugar (finely ground caster sugar) in place of 10ml sugar syrup. Stir sugar with other ingredients in base of shaker prior to adding ice and shaking to ensure fully dissolved.

name: Dry Martini - The 'Naked' or 'Direct' Martini
garnish: Chilled olive on stick or lemon zest twist
ingredients: ['1⁄6 shot Chilled water', '1⁄12 shot Martini Extra Dry vermouth', '2 1⁄2 shot Rutte Dry Gin']
steps:
1. Place glass and bottle of gin in freezer for at least two hours before making drink.
2. An hour before making drink POUR water into frozen glass, swirl around to coat and place back in freezer. Preferably do this with a little of the water at a time. Continue to swill around during freeing process to coat the sides of the glass.
3. When ready to serve drink, POUR chilled vermouth into icy glass and swirl to coat with vermouth.
4. POUR frozen gin into glass, garnish and serve immediately.
ingredients_clean: ['Chilled water', 'Martini Extra Dry vermouth', 'Rutte Dry Gin']

name: Flaming Ferrari
garnish: Assistant to help the drinker consume the concoction
ingredients: ['1⁄2 shot Giffard Grenadine syrup', "1 shot Galliano L'Autentico liqueur", '1 shot Black sambuca liqueur', '1 shot Green Chartreuse liqueur', '1 shot Grand Marnier or other cognac orange liqueur', '1 shot Navy rum (54.5% alc./vol.)']
steps:
Step 1: LAYER the first four ingredients by carefully pouring in order into a Martini glass.
Step 2: In two shot glasses POUR the remaining two ingredients separately.
Step 3: IGNITE the contents of the Martini glass. Give two long straws to the drinker and instruct them to drink the contents of the Martini glass in one go. As they do so, slowly POUR the contents of the two shot glasses into the flaming Martini glass.
ingredients_clean: ['Giffard Grenadine syrup', "Galliano L'Autentico liqueur", 'Black sambuca liqueur', 'Green Chartreuse liqueur', 'Grand Marnier or other cognac orange liqueur', 'Navy rum']

serving_suggestion: Serve in a Boston & shot glass
ingredients: ['1 shot Tuaca liqueur', '1⁄2 shot La Fée Parisienne absinthe']
steps: LAYER ingredients by carefully pouring into shot glass in the following order. IGNITE and hold pint glass upside down a few inches above the flame. Allow the drink to burn for thirty seconds or so before killing the flame, being sure to keep the pint glass in place. Instruct your subject to suck the alcohol vapour from the inverted pint glass using a bendy straw. Finally, remove the pint glass and let your subject consume the drink through the straw.

Serve in a Toddy glass

ingredients: ['1 shot The Busker Blended Irish Whiskey', '1⁄3 shot Demerara/Muscovado/brown sugar syrup (2 sugar:1 water)', '2 shot Filter coffee (hot)', '1 shot Double cream / heavy cream']
steps:
1. Select a heat-proof glass and pre-warm by filling with very hot water and leave to stand.
2. Separately prepare cream by lightly warming and whipping or shaking (ideally use a milk frother to whip your cream).
3. Empty the now warmed glass.
4. POUR whiskey, sugar syrup and hot coffee into pre-warmed glass and briefly stir.
5. FLOAT heated and aerated cream over the back of a warmed spoon.

name: Julep (Generic Name)
ingredients: ['12 fresh Mint leaves', '2 1⁄2 shot Brandy, whisk(e)y, gin, rum etc.', '3⁄4 shot Sugar syrup (65.0°brix, 2 sugar to 1 water rich syrup)', '3 dash Angostura Aromatic Bitters']
steps: Lightly MUDDLE mint leaves with spirit in base of shaker (just enough to bruise). (At this stage, if time allows, you should refrigerate the shaker, mint and spirit, and the glass in which the drink is to be served, for at least two hours.) Add other ingredients to shaker, SHAKE with ice and strain into glass filled with crushed ice. CHURN (stir) the drink with the crushed ice using a bar spoon. Top with more crushed ice to fill glass and churn again. Serve with straws.

steps: SHAKE all ingredients with ice and strain into ice-filled glass.
ingredients_clean: ['Rémy Martin Cognac', 'Grand Marnier or other cognac orange liqueur', 'La Fée Parisienne absinthe', 'Lemon juice', 'Sugar syrup', 'Angostura Aromatic Bitters', 'Chilled water']

name: Morning Glory Fizz
ingredients: ['2 shot Speyside single malt Scotch whisky (from freezer)', '1⁄12 shot La Fée Parisienne absinthe', '2⁄3 shot Lemon juice (freshly squeezed)', '1⁄3 shot Lime juice (freshly squeezed)', '1⁄2 shot Sugar syrup (65.0°brix, 2 sugar to 1 water rich syrup)', '2⁄3 shot Pasteurised egg white', 'Top up with Thomas Henry Soda Water']
steps:
SHAKE first 6 ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker. DRY SHAKE (without ice) and slowly pour 2/3rds of the contents of the shaker from a higher than normal height into a chilled empty glass (no ice in glass) while simultaneously pouring soda with your other hand. The cocktail and soda should form a single stream of liquid falling into the glass.

As when pouring a Guinness, to achieve a perfect head on a fizz, the cocktail should be left to settle for at least a minute before topping off with what remains in the shaker. Ideally, during the settling period, the glass should be placed in a glass froster/fridge/freezer. As the final contents of the shaker are poured into the glass so the head should rise like a souffle.
ingredients_clean: ['Speyside single malt Scotch whisky', 'La Fée Parisienne absinthe', 'Lemon juice', 'Lime juice', 'Sugar syrup', 'Pasteurised egg white', 'Top up with Thomas Henry Soda Water']

name: Passion Fruit Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
ingredients: ['1⁄2 fresh Lime (fresh) (chopped)', '3 spoon White caster sugar', '1 fresh Passion fruit (fresh fruit)', '2 shot Novo Fogo Silver cachaça (from freezer)']
steps:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add 3 bar spoons caster sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. Chop passion fruit in half and scoop flesh into the rocks glass and MUDDLE some more.

4. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

6. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).

name: Ramos Gin Fizz
garnish: Quarter orange wheel on rim (& optional mint sprig)
ingredients: ['2 shot Portobello Old Tom gin', '1⁄2 shot Lemon juice (freshly squeezed)', '1⁄2 shot Lime juice (freshly squeezed)', '3⁄4 shot Sugar syrup (65.0°brix, 2 sugar to 1 water rich syrup)', '1⁄24 shot Orange flower/blossom water', '3 drop Vanilla extract (optional)', '3⁄4 shot Pasteurised egg white', '3⁄4 shot Single cream / half-and-half', 'Top up with Thomas Henry Soda Water']
steps:
SHAKE first 8 ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker. DRY SHAKE (without ice) and slowly pour 2/3rds of the contents of the shaker from a higher than normal height into a chilled empty glass (no ice in glass) while simultaneously pouring soda with your other hand. The cocktail and soda should form a single stream of liquid falling into the glass.

As when pouring a Guinness, to achieve a perfect head on a Ramos Gin Fizz, the cocktail should be left to settle for at least a minute before topping off with what remains in the shaker. Ideally, during the settling period, the glass should be placed in a glass froster/fridge/freezer. As the final contents of the shaker are poured into the glass so the head should rise like a souffle.

Some Ramos Gin Fizz recipes, and indeed Henry Charles Ramos' original recipe, call for old tom gin (also our preference), in which case you may need to reduce the amount of sugar syrup depending on your old tom, personal tastes and citrus fruit.
ingredients_clean: ['Portobello Old Tom gin', 'Lemon juice', 'Lime juice', 'Sugar syrup', 'Orange flower blossom water', 'Vanilla extract', 'Pasteurised egg white', 'Single cream half and half', 'Top up with Thomas Henry Soda Water']

name: Raspberry Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
ingredients: ['1⁄2 fresh Lime (fresh) (chopped)', '3 spoon White caster sugar', '8 fresh Raspberries (fresh)', '2 shot Novo Fogo Silver cachaça (from freezer)']
steps:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add 3 bar spoons caster sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. Add raspberries and MUDDLE some more.

4. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

6. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients_clean: ['Lime', 'White caster sugar', 'Raspberries', 'Novo Fogo Silver cacha a']

name: Sazerac Cocktail (Difford's recipe)
ingredients: ['1⁄3 shot La Fée Parisienne absinthe', '2 1⁄3 shot Chilled water', '2⁄3 shot Rémy Martin 1738 Cognac', '2⁄3 shot Straight rye whiskey (100 proof / 50% alc./vol.)', '2⁄3 shot Bourbon whiskey', '1⁄3 shot Sugar syrup (65.0°brix, 2 sugar to 1 water rich syrup)', "3 dash Peychaud's or other Creole-style bitters", '1 dash Angostura Aromatic Bitters']
steps:
1. POUR absinthe into an ice-filled old-fashioned glass, TOP with water, and leave to stand.
2. THROW other ingredients with ice and set aside.
3. STRAIN contents of the old-fashioned glass into a chilled shot glass to be served as an optional extra alongside the main event.
4. STRAIN contents of shaker into the absinthe rinsed old-fashioned glass.
5. Enjoy a delicious Sazerac with an absinthe shot served alongside.
ingredients_clean: ['La Fée Parisienne absinthe', 'Chilled water', 'Rémy Martin Cognac', 'Straight rye whiskey', 'Bourbon whiskey', 'Sugar syrup', "Peychaud's or other Creole style bitters", 'Angostura Aromatic Bitters']

name: Ti Punch
garnish: The lime disc in the drink is garnish enough but also consider expressing a lime zest twist over the drink and then discarding.
ingredients: ['1 1⁄2 shot Martinique blanc rhum agricole', '1⁄4 shot Clement Sirop de Canne', '1 slice Lime (fresh)']
steps:
Traditionally the limes used to make this drink are not cut into slices or wedges. Instead, a round disc is cut from the side of the fruit. These are cut large enough that some of the fruit's flesh backs the peel of the disc.

POUR the rum and sugar into glass. Then SQUEEZE the lime disc between finger and thumb before dropping into the drink. This expresses the oil from the skin and little of the juice into the Ti'Punch. STIR and consider adding ice - either one or two large cubes depending on glass size, or preferably, a small chunk of block ice.
ingredients_clean: ['Martinique blanc rhum agricole', 'Clement Sirop de Canne', 'slice Lime']

name: Tom & Jerry
ingredients: ['2 fresh Egg white', '2 fresh Egg yolk', '6 spoon White caster sugar', '1⁄2 shot Overproof pot still rum', '2 pinch Cinnamon powder', '2 pinch Clove', '3 pinch Freshly grated nutmeg', '1 1⁄2 shot Rémy Martin 1738 Cognac', '1⁄2 shot Havana Club 7yo rum', 'Top up with Boiling water']
steps:
1. Pre-warm six 20cl (6.75oz) toddy glasses or Tom & Jerry mugs with hot water.
2. Using a whisk, BEAT the yolks in a mixing bowl "until they are thin as water." Add sugar, Jamaican rum, spices and STIR thoroughly with whisk.
3. In a separate bowl, use a whisk to BEAT the egg whites "to a stiff froth."
4. Use a tablespoon to FOLD the frothy egg whites into the spiced and beaten yolk mixture. This produces the gloopy base mixture known as 'Tom & Jerry batter'.
5. To make individual drinks, to each of the warmed glasses or mugs, POUR cognac and rum, and add two table spoons of Tom & Jerry batter. STIR each glass/mug thoroughly with a barspoon while topping with boiling water.
6. Each should end up with frothy head ready to receive the garnish of grated nutmeg. Serve and enjoy.
ingredients_clean: ['Egg white', 'Egg yolk', 'White caster sugar', 'Overproof pot still rum', 'pinch Cinnamon powder', 'pinch Clove', 'pinch Freshly grated nutmeg', 'Rémy Martin Cognac', 'Havana Club rum', 'Top up with Boiling water']

name: Tropical Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
ingredients: ['1⁄2 fresh Lime (fresh) (chopped)', '3 spoon White caster sugar', '1 1⁄2 shot Novo Fogo Silver cachaça (from freezer)', '1⁄2 shot Coconut rum liqueur (35-40% alc./vol.)', '3⁄4 shot Pineapple juice (fresh pressed)']
steps:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add 3 bar spoons caster sugar (or ½oz/15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

4 POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer), coconut liqueur and pineapple juice (also chilled) into the shaker base or glass used to muddle and swirl to rinse before pouring into serving glass. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

5. Use an Ice Tapper to crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients_clean: ['Lime', 'White caster sugar', 'Novo Fogo Silver cacha a', 'Coconut rum liqueur', 'Pineapple juice']

steps:
1. Lightly MUDDLE mint with rum in base of glass. Use your bar spoon to raise the bruised mint up and around the inside of the glass to coat with fragrant mint oils.
2. Add other ingredients and two-thirds fill glass with crushed ice.
3. SWIZZLE with a swizzle stick or CHURN (stir) with a bar spoon.
4. Fill glass with more crushed ice.

name: Benton's Old Fashioned
ingredients: ['2 shot Bourbon whiskey (bacon fat washed)', '1⁄4 shot Maple syrup', '2 dash Angostura Aromatic Bitters']
steps:
STIR bourbon and maple syrup in base of mixing glass until syrup dissolves. Add bitters and ice and STIR again. Strain into ice-filled glass.

To make fat-washed bourbon: Grill 4 slices of bacon (originally made using Benton's bacon, hence the name, but any extra-smoky bacon will suffice) to obtain 30ml/1oz of warm bacon fat and pour this into 70cl of bourbon (in a 75cl bottle). Leave to infuse at room temperature for a day before placing the bottle in a freezer to solidify the fat. Then clarify the bourbon by straining it into a clean bottle.
ingredients_clean: ['Bourbon whiskey', 'Maple syrup', 'Angostura Aromatic Bitters']

steps: SHAKE first 4 ingredients with ice and strain into ice-filled glass. TOP with lemonade.

name: Blue Moon Cocktail (Dale DeGroff's recipe)
ingredients: ['1 fresh Blueberries (fresh)', '2 shot Ketel One Vodka', '1 spoon Oolong tea', '1⁄2 shot St-Germain elderflower liqueur', '3⁄4 shot Lemon juice (freshly squeezed)', '1⁄2 shot Agave syrup', '1 fresh Sage leaves']
steps: Lightly MUDDLE blueberry in base of shaker (just to break skin). ADD vodka and one heaped spoon of oolong tea and stir in base of shaker for 60 seconds (or better still, leave to steep for ten minutes). Add other ingredients, SHAKE with ice and fine strain into chilled glass.
ingredients_clean: ['Blueberries', 'Ketel One Vodka', 'Oolong tea', 'St Germain elderflower liqueur', 'Lemon juice', 'Agave syrup', 'Sage leaves']

name: Buttercup cocktail
garnish: The original recipe calls for a lemon zest twist but the lemon oils overpower the butterscotch. So if you use a slither of lemon skin on which to nestle a Werther's Original, don't express the lemon's oils over the drink. WARNING: Don't be tempted to use buttercup flowers as they are poisonous. They are also poisonous when eaten by livestock but their acrid taste and the blistering of the mouth they cause mean that animals don't tend to eat them. Interestingly, the toxins degrade when dried, so hay containing dried buttercups is safe for animals to eat.

ingredients: ['1 1⁄3 shot Patrón Silver blanco tequila', '1 1⁄6 shot *Special ingredient #1 (see above)', '2⁄3 shot Lime juice (freshly squeezed)', '1⁄2 shot *Special ingredient #2 (see above)', '1⁄2 shot Sugar syrup (65.0°brix, 2 sugar to 1 water rich syrup)', '4 drop *Special ingredient #3 (see above)']
steps:
Special Ingredient #1 - Yellow Juice
2 part yellow beetroot to 1 part yellow bell pepper and 1 part yellow tomato

Special Ingredient #2 - Pepper Falernum
1 chile de arbol
1 jalapeno
1 bottle Velvet Falernum

Coarsely chop 1 chile de arbol and 1 jalapeno and infuse with a bottle of velvet falernum for 3 days. Strain and re-bottle.

Special Ingredient #3 - Pink Saline Solution
Combine 5 parts water to 1 part Himalayan pink salt. Stir to dissolve and store in a dropper bottle.

Rim a rocks glass with fine ground dried parsley and Himalayan salt. ADD all the ingredients to a cocktail shaker, SHAKE vigorously with ice and STRAIN into the glass with ice. Garnish with yellow beet pickles.
ingredients_clean: ['Patr n Silver blanco tequila', 'Special ingredient', 'Lime juice', 'Special ingredient', 'Sugar syrup', 'Special ingredient']

name: Mercado Roma
ingredients: ['1 2⁄3 shot Patrón Silver blanco tequila', '1 shot Pink grapefruit juice (freshly squeezed)', '2⁄3 shot *Special ingredient #1 (see above)', '1 spoon *Special ingredient #2 (see above)', '1 dash Angostura Aromatic Bitters']
steps:
SHAKE all ingredients with ice and strain into ice-filled glass (preferably a chunk of block ice).

Special Ingredient #1: Pineapple Ancho Shrub
Blend equal parts pineapple juice and sugar and leave to rest for 2 hours. Add equal parts white wine vinegar and leave for 24 hours. Then add a teaspoon of chipotle sauce and blend.

Special Ingredient #2: Clove Honey
Add equal parts honey, water and a handful of cloves to a pot and heat at 180˚C for 25 minutes stirring constantly.

steps:
Combine all ingredients and stir (without ice). POUR into a litre bottle and leave to chill in a refrigerator. To serve, STIR 2 shots / 2oz / 60ml of the bottled mixture with ice and strain into chilled glass. Makes 16 drinks.

This recipe is also perfect for making a barrel aged Manhattan and will fill a one litre mini cask. Obviously, multiply recipe if using a larger cask.

name: Friend of Jack
garnish: Cone filled with roasted & salted walnuts pegged to rim (roast walnuts with sea salt in pan for about 15/20 min on low heat)
ingredients: ['1 shot *Special ingredient #1 (see above)', '1 shot *Special ingredient #2 (see above)', '1⁄6 shot *Special ingredient #3 (see above)', '1⁄6 shot Blood orange liqueur', '2 dash Fernet liqueur']
steps:
STIR all ingredients with ice and strain into chilled glass.

Special ingredient #1: Duck fat washed Jack Daniel’s Old No. 7
Pour bottle of Jack Daniel’s into pan with 200g duck fat. Cook on low heat until duck fat melted. Allow to cool enough to pour into a sealable container and then freeze. This will allow the duck fat to be strained out of the whiskey. Return the duck fat washed whiskey to bottle for use.

Special ingredient #2: Pear & Honey Posca
Skin 5 pears and cook with bottle of white wine and ½ cup of honey until pears become translucent. Strain throw coffee filter and bottle ready for use.

Special ingredient #3: Tansy & pisco tincture
Infuse 200ml pisco with 5 soup spoons of tansy for 3 days or cook for 3 hours/55˚C in water bath. Strain through coffee filter and the tincture is ready to use.
ingredients_clean: ['Special ingredient', 'Special ingredient', 'Special ingredient', 'Blood orange liqueur', 'Fernet liqueur']

name: A Modern Day Jack
ingredients: ['1 1⁄3 shot Daddy Rack Tennessee Whiskey', '1⁄3 shot Dutch Cacao white crème de cacao', '1 2⁄3 shot *Special ingredient #1 (see above)', "2 dash Bob's Chocolate bitters"]
steps:
SHAKE all ingredients with ice and strain into chilled glass.

Special ingredient #1: Homemade salted caramel sauce
3 parts demerara sugar to 1 part double cream with a pinch of sea salt. Heat sugar until it has become liquid and started to caramalise, separately heat the double cream till warm, then add cream to the sugar and stir until golden brown and the sugar has completely dissolved. Add your salt and stir further. Allow to cool at room temperature (if you put it in the fridge it will become too solid to mix).

Special ingredient #1: Homemade Peach and clove liqueur
Roast peach stones (that are left over by the kitchen) and add with cloves to a combination of overproof white rum and high proof vodka and leave to infuse for 36 hours. Separately, made a peach iced tea from teabags cold infused for 24 hours. Blend the two infusions together with sugar and peach juice.

steps:
DRY SHAKE (without ice) all ingredients and strain back into shaker. SHAKE with ice and fine strain into chilled glass.

Special ingredient #1: Fig and sage syrup
Pour 1 litre water into a pan with 2 packets (100g each pack) of dried figs and bring to the boil. Reduce the heat, add 1.4kg sugar and stir to make a syrup. Take off heat and add two stems worth of sage leaves. Leave to stew and stir occasionally. Once cooled, strain off the figs and leaves and bottle. Store in a refrigerator prior to use.

steps: SHAKE all ingredients with ice and fine strain into chilled glass.

name: Estrella Porno Martini
ingredients: ['1 1⁄2 fresh Passion fruit (fresh fruit)', '2 shot Patrón Silver blanco tequila', '1⁄2 shot Passoã liqueur', '1⁄2 shot Vanilla sugar syrup', '1⁄2 shot Lime juice (freshly squeezed)', '2 shot Brut Champagne']
steps:
1. To make a Estrella Porno Martini you’ll first need to flavour your tequila with a vanilla pod. Simply cut the vanilla pod lengthways to expose the flavoursome seeds inside and drop the whole vanilla pod into your bottle of tequila. Reseal and shake bottle several times a day for at least two days, preferably a week.

2. To make your cocktail, wash and cut passion fruits in half, SCOOP out the seeds and flesh of 3 halves into shaker. (Keep last passion fruit half for garnish). Add next four ingredients (all but champagne), SHAKE with ice and fine strain into chilled glass. POUR champagne into chilled shot glass to serve on the side. Instruct drinker to sip alternately from each glass.
ingredients_clean: ['Passion fruit', 'Patr n Silver blanco tequila', 'Passo liqueur', 'Vanilla sugar syrup', 'Lime juice', 'Brut Champagne']

name: Blueberry Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
ingredients: ['1⁄2 fresh Lime (fresh) (chopped)', '3 spoon White caster sugar', '10 fresh Blueberries (fresh)', '2 shot Novo Fogo Silver cachaça (from freezer)']
steps:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add 3 bar spoons caster sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. Add blueberries and MUDDLE some more.

4. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

6. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients_clean: ['Lime', 'White caster sugar', 'Blueberries', 'Novo Fogo Silver cacha a']

name: Blackberry Agave Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
ingredients: ['1⁄2 fresh Lime (fresh) (chopped)', '6 fresh Blackberries', '1 shot Agave syrup', '2 shot Novo Fogo Silver cachaça (from freezer)']
steps:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass and MUDDLE.

2. Add blackberries and MUDDLE some more.

3. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

4. Add agave syrup to serving glass.

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

6. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients_clean: ['Lime', 'Blackberries', 'Agave syrup', 'Novo Fogo Silver cacha a']

name: French Kiwi & Apple Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
ingredients: ['1⁄2 fresh Lime (fresh) (chopped)', '3 spoon White caster sugar', '1⁄2 fresh Kiwi fruit (fresh)', '1⁄6 shot Pernod anise', '1⁄2 shot Apple juice', '2 shot Novo Fogo Silver cachaça (from freezer)']
steps:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add 3 bar spoons caster sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. Add Kiwi fruit and MUDDLE some more.

4. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. Add apple juice and anis liqueur, then STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

6. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients_clean: ['Lime', 'White caster sugar', 'Kiwi fruit', 'Pernod anise', 'Apple juice', 'Novo Fogo Silver cacha a']

garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
ingredients: ['1⁄2 fresh Lime (fresh) (chopped)', '3 spoon Powdered sugar (ground in mortar and pestle)', '1⁄2 cupful Watermelon (fresh) (chopped)', '2 shot Novo Fogo Silver cachaça (from freezer)']
steps:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add 3 bar spoons caster sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. Add watermelon and MUDDLE some more.

4. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

6. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes using an Ice Tapper and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients_clean: ['Lime', 'Powdered sugar', 'cupful Watermelon', 'Novo Fogo Silver cacha a']

name: Back to Basics Cocktail

steps:
SHAKE all ingredients with ice and fine strain into chilled glass.

Special ingredient #1: Orange and red wine syrup - cube 1 orange, adding half the peel from a 2nd orange and soak in 300g sugar for up to 1.5 hours. Simmer with 330 ml red wine (Merlot) until the alcohol evaporates (around 10 mins).

steps:
SHAKE all ingredients with ice and strain into ice-filled glass.

Special ingredient #1: Spiced passion fruit syrup – made by dissolving 1000g Turbinado sugar in 500g of simmering water until dissolved. Store refrigerated one week.

SHAKE all ingredients with ice and strain into ice-filled cayenne-chile salt-rimmed glass.

Special ingredient #1: Blackberry shrub - combine equal parts blackberries, cane sugar and red wine vinegar in a blender, blend until liquefied, then strain out solids.

Special ingredient #2: Cayenne-chile syrup - combine 1 cup sugar, one cup water, 1 teaspoon chile powder, 1 teaspoon cayenne in a saucepan and bring to a simmer. name: Caipirinha (no added sugar & low-calorie)
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
ingredients: ['1⁄2 fresh Lime (fresh)', '1⁄2 shot Sugar-free sweetener', '3⁄4 shot Chilled water', '1 1⁄2 shot Novo Fogo Silver cachaça']
steps:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and slice on half into 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add sweetener and MUDDLE.

3. If using cubed ice straight from the freezer, add chilled water (or optionally add fruit of your choice) and MUDDLE some more. If using watery ice then omit water.

4. When sure muddling has fully extracted fruit juice, POUR the muddled fruit and sweetener into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (the glass used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to mix with other ingredients.

6. If using cubed ice, crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients_clean: ['Lime', 'Sugar free sweetener', 'Chilled water', 'Novo Fogo Silver cacha a']

name: Golden Hour Margarita
ingredients: ['1 1⁄2 shot Patrón Reposado tequila', '1⁄2 shot Patron Citronge', '1 shot Pineapple juice (fresh pressed)', '1⁄2 shot Lime juice (freshly squeezed)', '1⁄4 shot *Special ingredient #1 (see above)']
steps:
This drink can be shaken and served on the rocks or frozen. Rim a glass with a mixture of equal parts salt, turmeric and chilli pepper. SHAKE all ingredients or blend to combine. Pour into rimmed glass (filled with ice if you used a shaker).

Special ingredient #1: Tumeric agave syrup - 2 cups agave, 1 cup water, 2 tablespoons turmeric powder. Add agave, water and turmeric to a saucepan. Simmer for 10 minutes, stirring frequently to incorporate the turmeric. Let cool and strain into a sealable bottle.

Special ingredient #1: Lemon sherbet
Peel 20 lemons. Juice the lemons, measure the liquid quantity and set aside. Measure 4 parts caster sugar for every 5 parts lemon juice and add to the lemon peels to leave overnight. name: Clarified Vodka Milk Punch
serving_suggestion:
Serve in an Old-fashioned glass
Photographed in a Libbey Old Fashioned 11oz
ingredients: ['6 2⁄3 shot Brewed cold black breakfast tea', '6 2⁄3 shot Lemon juice (freshly squeezed)', 'fresh Lemon peel', '6 2⁄3 shot Orange juice (freshly squeezed)', 'fresh Orange peel', '2 shot Ketel One Vodka', '1 shot Sugar syrup (65.0°brix, 2 sugar to 1 water rich syrup)', '6 2⁄3 shot Milk (whole milk/full 3-4% fat)', '1 2⁄3 shot Ketel One Vodka', '1⁄4 shot Sugar syrup (65.0°brix, 2 sugar to 1 water rich syrup)']
steps:
Milk Punch Base pre-batch (scale-up recipe according to requirement)
1. POUR first 7 ingredients (with peels from the zests lemons & orange) into a sealable container and leave to infuse for 12 hours in a refrigerator.
2. Hot milk method HEAT milk until just starting to simmer and pour (while still simmering) into the container containing vodka tea and juice mix. The milk should curdle. Reseal and chill for at least 2-3 hours and up to 24 hours.
OR 2. Cold milk method POUR cold milk into the container containing vodka tea and juice mix. The milk should curdle. Reseal and chill for at least 2-3 hours and up to 24 hours.
3. Fine STRAIN mixture through cheesecloth or Superbag into a large jar or another container. Ideally, this should be in a refrigerator (I removed a shelf in ours) with the cheesecloth/bag hung over the jar.
4. Repeat step three, without removing curds from the filter or move to a finer strainer (e.g. from a 400-micron bag to a 100-micron bag) or coffee filter.
5. Stored in the refrigerator this will keep for a week (and potentially months) but be sure to sterilise containers etc.

Cocktail itself
STIR 50ml pre-prepared Milk Punch Base with 50ml vodka and 7.5ml sugar syrup and strain into ice-filled glass (preferably over a chunk of block ice)
ingredients_clean: ['Brewed cold black breakfast tea', 'Lemon juice', 'Lemon peel', 'Orange juice', 'Orange peel', 'Ketel One Vodka', 'Sugar syrup', 'Milk', 'Ketel One Vodka', 'Sugar syrup']

name: Strawberry Caipirinha
garnish: Stirrer (spoon, wooden lolly stick or stick cut from sugar cane)
serving_suggestion:
Serve in a Highball (max 10oz/300ml)
Photographed in a Libbey Highball 9oz
ingredients: ['1⁄2 fresh Lime (fresh) (chopped)', '3 spoon Powdered sugar (ground in mortar and pestle)', '3 fresh Small ripe strawberries (hulled)', '2 shot Novo Fogo Silver cachaça (from freezer)']
steps:
1. Cut lime in half (from pole to pole) and then slice one of the halves into eight 3-4mm thick half-moon shaped segments and drop into the base of a robust rocks glass.

2. Add 3 bar spoons powdered caster sugar (or ½oz / 15ml sugar syrup 2:1) and MUDDLE.

3. Add strawberries and MUDDLE some more.

4. When sure fruit juice is fully extracted and the sugar dissolved, transfer the muddled fruit and sugar into serving glass (preferably a 30cl / 10oz hi-ball glass).

5. POUR cachaça (stored in the freezer) into the rocks glass (used to muddle) and swirl to rinse glass before pouring cachaça into serving glass. STIR to ensure all ingredients are well mixed.

6. Crack (rather than crush) four to five large ice cubes using an Ice Tapper and drop into serving glass. STIR before topping with more ice and serve with a stirrer (but no straws).
ingredients_clean: ['Lime', 'Powdered sugar', 'Small ripe strawberries', 'Novo Fogo Silver cacha a']

name: Oye Mi Canto (Hear My Song)
garnish: White edible flowers pegged to rim
ingredients: ['1 shot Patrón Silver blanco tequila (infused with tamarind)', '2 shot Rosato/rosé vermouth', '1⁄6 shot Del Maguey VIDA mezcal', '1 dash Orange Bitters by Angostura']
steps:
To make the tequila and tamarind infusion: Infuse 250 gram (9oz) of chopped tamarind flesh in 70cl/75cl blanco tequila for 2 days in a vacuum-sealed bag (or 2 weeks in a Kilner jar). Strain through a 100-micron Superbag and rebottle ready for use.

To make the cocktail: STIR all ingredients with ice and fine strain into chilled glass.

name: Lemon Drop Crusta
garnish: Select a small wine or flute glass with a rim diameter that will snugly accommodate a small lemon tightly enough to act as a watertight extension to the glass. Cut off both ends of the fruit and carefully remove the pulp to leave a barrel-shaped shell of skin. Place in the top of the glass. Wet the edge of the glass and exposed fruit shell with sugar syrup and dip in caster sugar to frost the edge of both peel and glass. Leave for a couple of hours to form a hard crust.

name: Bird of Paradise Gin Fizz
serving_suggestion:
Serve in a Highball (max 10oz/300ml)
Photographed in a Libbey Levitas 6.75oz
ingredients: ['2 shot Portobello Old Tom gin', '1 shot Lime juice (freshly squeezed)', '1⁄2 shot Raspberry (framboise) sugar syrup', '3 drop Orange flower/blossom water', '2⁄3 shot Pasteurised egg white', 'Top up with Thomas Henry Soda Water']
steps:
SHAKE first 5 ingredients with ice and strain back into shaker. DRY SHAKE (without ice) and slowly pour 2/3rds of the contents of the shaker from a higher than normal height into a chilled empty glass (no ice in glass) while simultaneously pouring soda with your other hand. The cocktail and soda should form a single stream of liquid falling into the glass.

As when pouring a Guinness, to achieve a perfect head on a fizz, the cocktail should be left to settle for at least a minute before topping off with what remains in the shaker. Ideally, during the settling period, the glass should be placed in a glass froster/fridge/freezer. As the final contents of the shaker are poured into the glass so the head should rise like a souffle.
ingredients_clean: ['Portobello Old Tom gin', 'Lime juice', 'Raspberry sugar syrup', 'Orange flower blossom water', 'Pasteurised egg white', 'Top up with Thomas Henry Soda Water']
